abstracts.cdata!:
The Urgent Environmental Investment
            Project involves building a sturgeon hatchery, oil field
            cleanup, and mercury cleanup. In regard to the sturgeon
            hatchery, water pollution during the hatchery operation will
            be minimized by proper wastewater treatment. Hatchery wastes
            will be collected in concrete bins and burned regularly. To
            mitigate the impact of cross-breeding of sturgeon species,
            tanks will be used to segregate various species of breeding
            stock and roe will be hand fertilized from know donor
            species. There will be measures to control dust from the
            feedmill and worker training to minimize exposure. To clean
            up the oil field, wastes will be categorized by contaminants
            and severity for disposal. There will be adequate on-site
            storage facilities for handling recovered oil. Anti-dusting
            measures will be used during the oil field cleanup. The
            major impact of the mercury cleanup is the removal and safe
            disposal of a large amount of toxic mercury. A mercury
            recovery technology which meets international standards will
            be used. After the mercury recovery, the soil will be
            dewatered and then transported to the landfill for safe
            disposal by covered trucks along a route away from inhabited
            areas. Pilot tests will be carried out to identify an
            effective way of dewatering and stabilizing waste sludges
            stored on the mercury recovery plant site. Excess water will
            also be treated before discharge to the Caspian Sea.
